Instructions.text: Press the gray button written FEED to see the Feed graphs. The stream going from the mine to the flotation circuit is usually called FEED. It has a certain grade of valuable metal, in our case copper.
Look at the graph. What is the copper grade of this stream?
Well done. What about the flow rate of the Feed Stream?
That's correct. You could have guessed since flow rate is given by tons per hour.
What is the flow rate of Concentrate Stream? Make sure your air is at 2 cm/s and froth is at -10 cm.

Correct. It means that from the 10 tons entering your flotation cell, 2 tons go to the Concentrate, which is the material that we can process and sell, while the other 8 tons go to the Tailings stream, which we didn't show for didactic purposes.
As a flotation operator you want to make sure you are producing the right amount of Concentrate according to your Feed flow rate.
After all, producing 6 tons of Concentrate out of 6 tons of Feed is very profitable, while producing 6 tons out of 600 hundred tons of Feed will make you bankrupt.
You can check if you are doing a good job by finding the CONCENTRATION RATIO. It represents the amount of tons you need to feed the cell in order to produce one ton of concentrate.
For example, if your concentrate flow rate is 1 t/h with a feed flow rate of 10 t/h, your concentration ratio is 10. The cell needs 10 tons of feed to produce one ton of concentrate.

Let's practice. Set the air to 1 cm/s and froth to -15 cm. What is the Concentrate Ratio of this process?

 Concentration ratio =
Feed flow rate / Concentrate flow rate
Exactly! In the next lessons, we will learn about other performance calculations. Good job for now!
